snippet: The Texas National Guard refused to process requests from same-sex couples for benefits, while Mississippi will not issue applications from state-owned offices.
abstract: Texas National Guard refuses to process requests from same-sex couples for benefits despite Pentagon directive to do so; Mississippi says it will not issue applications from state-owned offices; both states cite bans on gay marriage.
lead_paragraph: The Texas National Guard refused to process requests from same-sex couples for benefits, while Mississippi will not issue applications from state-owned offices.

headline.main: 2 States Won’t Process Guards’ Same-Sex Benefits
headline.print_headline: 2 States Won’t Process Guards’ Same-Sex Benefits

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
